heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 26 October 2025 and it lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (222°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the outside temperature (up 3.4°C), feels like temperature (up 3.2°C), and inside temperature (up 1.5°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 7%) and rainfall (down 0.2 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (down 497 m).

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 496.7m higher than yesterday, 434.1m higher than the past week, 191.0m higher than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 604m and a peak of 2320m, averaging 1548.5m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and little or no wind. Possible light showers, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and bright intervals likely. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
